channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12312] Another couple of createTable race conditions
item.description: Found a couple more failing tests in TestAccessController and TestScanEarlyTermination caused by my favorite race condition. Will post a patch in a second.
item.summary: Another couple of createTable race conditions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Should we just remove wait until table enabled?

Well I think there is a case for that (some tests disable a table, do something, and then need to wait for it get enabled again). In general, though, HBA#createTable should be followed by HBTU#waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned.
Oops, forgot a handful of cases in my patch. Trying again; sorry for the noise.

Found a few more of these in other tests... will update patch shortly.
TestReplicationBase had the same problem; resolved with a new HBTU constructor, which also cleaned up some duplicated code.

This message is automatically generated.

Finally got around to fixing this. In this case, since we are actually creating two miniclusters in one test, it's easiest to actually invoke HBTU#waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned in the test (as opposed to my normal procedure of calling HBTU#createTable).
